content:
You are a reader assistant. You simplify a passage from a scientific paper to make it more readable by performing an iterative algorithm that focuses on atomic changes.

You are also given two parameters: DC (Desired Complexity) – a desired complexity of the simplified text, and ILT (Information Loss Tolerance) – a threshold for information loss compared to original passage that specifies whether an atomic change should be accepted or not.

The algorithm is as follows:
1. Determine if the text is at desired complexity (DC), if yes, terminate the algorithm, else continue.
2. Identify a section of the text whose complexity is above DC.
3. Propose a simplification of the identified section.
4. Identify information loss and the severity of it – if the severity for any of the information loss questions is higher than information loss tolerance (ILT), reject changes, else update the current state of the passage
5. Adjust the passage to maintain readability and flow of text, then run a new iteration of the algorithm.

When the algorithm terminates, you print the final simplified passage

When responding to prompts, only respond to the given question and do not proceed to the next step

The passage:
This is moving us to a tipping point and to a crossroads: we must decide between a society in which the actions are determined in a top-down way and then implemented by coercion or manipulative technologies (such as personalized ads and nudging) or a society, in which decisions are taken in a free and participatory way and mutually coordinated.

DC: University student
ILT: Medium
Identify which parts of the text are the most complex, then the complexity level of the passage. Limit your answer to a maximum of 5 sentences

The most complex parts of the text are the phrases "tipping point," "top-down way," and "mutually coordinated," which may be unfamiliar to a university student. The passage's complexity level is around 6.5 on a 1-10 scale, where 1 is very simple and 10 is very complex. This is due to the use of abstract concepts and technical vocabulary. The text's readability is at a level that requires some background knowledge or clarification.
Is determined complexity higher than DC (University student)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
Yes
Identify a single complicated section of the passage. Remember to respect the ILT (Medium) contraint. Only provide the identified section
we must decide between a society in which the actions are determined in a top-down way and then implemented by coercion or manipulative technologies (such as personalized ads and nudging)
Simplify this section. Only provide the proposed simplification
we must choose between a society where decisions are made from the top down and one where people participate in decision-making
Reincorporate the simplified section into the passage
This is moving us to a tipping point and to a crossroads: we must choose between a society where decisions are made from the top down and one where people participate in decision-making.

Identify information loss and its severity in the updated passage compared to the original. Comparison must be between the originally provided (the very first) passage and the current simplified version. Limit your answer to a maximum of 5 sentences

The original passage mentioned "coercion or manipulative technologies (such as personalized ads and nudging)" which is not present in the simplified version, resulting in an information loss. The severity of this loss is high because the original phrase provided a specific example of the top-down approach, which is now missing in the simplified version. This information loss is above the ILT (Medium) threshold, so the simplification should be rejected. The simplified passage loses some nuance and context.
What is the highest severity level identified in your last answer? Is it higher than ILT (Medium)? Provide the highest severity level, followed by an answer to the ILT question as "Yes" or "No"

High
No
Identify which parts of the text are the most complex, then the complexity level of the passage. Limit your answer to a maximum of 5 sentences

The most complex parts of the text are the phrase "tipping point" and "crossroads", which may be unfamiliar to a university student. The passage's complexity level is around 5.5 on a 1-10 scale, where 1 is very simple and 10 is very complex. This is due to the use of abstract concepts. The text's readability is at a level that is slightly challenging for a university student. The simplified section is still a bit complex for a university student.
Is determined complexity higher than DC (University student)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
No
Print the final version of the simplified passage, include only the text of the passage with no comments or additional punctuation, and do not provide the original passage
This is moving us to a tipping point and to a crossroads: we must choose between a society where decisions are made from the top down and one where people participate in decision-making.
